Scene Class Reference
[Hierarchical graphics library]

#include <Scene.h>

Inheritance diagram for Scene:

[legend]
List of all members.

Detailed Description

Root node of scene node hierarchy.

Provides support for scene file input. Contains data which apply to all nodes.

enum  FogType { FOG_NONE, FOG_LINEAR }

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum Scene::FogType

Fog mode.

Exact usage of this depends on used rendering pipeline.

Enumerator:
FOG_NONE  No fog.

FOG_LINEAR  Linear fog controlled by fogStart and fogEnd.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Scene::Scene ( NS(gr, Context)*  context,
const NS(lang, String)&  filename,
ResourceManager *  res = 0,
const NS(lang, String)&  texturepath = "",
const NS(lang, String)&  shaderpath = "",
const NS(lang, String)&  particlepath = "" 
)

Loads a scene from hgr file.

Parameters:
context Rendering context to be used while loading.
filename Scene file name relative to current working directory.
res Resource manager to load textures and particles from.
texturepath Texture path relative to current working directory.
shaderpath Shader path relative to current working directory.
particlepath Particle system path relative to current working directory.
Exceptions:
IOException 
GraphicsException 

Member Function Documentation

void Scene::applyAnimations ( float  time,
float  dt 
)

Applies hierarchy transforms from transform animation set and updates particle systems.

Parameters:
time Current absolute time in seconds.
dt Time since last update in seconds.

Camera* Scene::camera (  ) 

Returns the first camera in the scene.

If camera is not found then default camera is created, parented and returned.

virtual Node* Scene::clone (  )  const [virtual]

Returns clone of this node.

Clones child nodes as well.

Reimplemented from Node.

void Scene::merge ( Scene *  other  ) 

Merges another scene to this one.

Note that animations are indexed by name so some animations might be lost from this scene.

void Scene::printHierarchy (  )  const

Prints scene hierarchy to debug output.

Useful for debugging loaded scenes.

void Scene::removeLightsAndCameras (  ) 

Removes lights and cameras from the scene.

Objects are removed only if they don't have any children. Commonly used for example when merging character scene to the level.
